text: [Music]
for a long time we were completely
blocked in China um for more than two
years all languages completely blocked
uh just recently they unblocked um the
BBC and then soon after that unblocked
the English Wikipedia um I've heard
conflict reports just in the last couple
days I got an email from somebody who
said that we're blocked again in China
but I haven't confirmed that yet so I
think it's a little touch and go at the
moment but that's only the English the
Chinese language version is still
blocked uh so yeah it's a problem uh and
it's a problem that uh it's it's an
interesting one because when I've been
in China um it turns out the firewall is
very very porous um young people all
know how to get around it I mean it's
just like uh you know it it may be
illegal to download illegal music or
movies uh in the US but the kids do it
right so um it's the same thing there
right uh people know how to get around
the firewall young people technical
people journalists um and and they do
they get around it but still that's not
to say that it's no problem right
because lots and lots of people don't
bother or they're afraid to try or
whatever
um but the the other aspect of this that
I think people don't really recognize
nearly enough is that um um a big part
of uh what I think is going on with the
internet censorship in China is not
really about control of political
information um that's a part of it um
but if you wanted to control political
information uh well with respect to
Wikipedia you would probably just block
certain pages you wouldn't block the
whole thing but there's also a certain
element of protectionism going on uh and
so uh we just recently had uh the uh the
head of Buu made a statement that uh
Chinese people shouldn't use wikkipedia
they should use B biki bedia it's their
version um which they copied all of
Wikipedia and didn't give us credit and
all those kind of classic things that
people criticize Chinese companies for
um but they uh but he his his remarks
about it struck me as being very uh
nationalist in nature in other words
don't use this foreign thing use the
Homegrown Chinese version um whereas we
don't really view it in that light I
mean he tried to paint Wikipedia is an
American project but we're very Global
and we don't even think of that it's a
movement of the people of the world um
and we would prefer if if China would
participate in that and certainly
Chinese Wikipedia is very very healthy
and uh we think it's successful and uh
you know and I also don't mind him
making that argument right he can make
that argument but it's a little
disingenuous I think to to make that
argument uh when you realize that uh gee
it's uh it's it's it's a little silly to
be making that argument when you uh also
have you know Wikipedia completely
blocked in China it's like are we really
that much of a threat that you still
have to talk down about us uh even
though we're blocked uh because I think
uh you know if we were available then
people would use ours and not buy D so
um but anyway it's it's it's the kind of
thing that um I think it's a policy
mistake for China um I I try to be
pretty low-key about it U because um I
actually want this to change in the long
run uh and so it's for us it's just a
matter of really uh staying consistent
and saying look you know Wikipedia is
not a a hot bed of of radicals who are
trying to overthrow the Chinese
government it's mostly about you know
the moon and tigers and Pokemon and
whatnot so uh it's not really the kind
of thing that we think uh they should be
blocking so we
